TEXT: The applicant , Mr Leonid Ivanovich Kuznetsov , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant lived and worked in PERSON , a territory in the extreme LOC of GPE . In DATE the applicant fell victim to a work - related accident causing PERCENT disability . During DATE following the accident he received regular indemnity payments from his former employer , a private company “ FAC ( hereinafter referred to as “ the company ” ) .

In DATE the company stopped these payments . On DATE the applicant lodged an action against the company , seeking recovery of regular payments and compensation of pecuniary damages in the total amount of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL and compensation of non - pecuniary damages in the amount of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL . This action was filed with ORG of GPE .

On DATE the applicant applied to the court with a view to replace the defendant . He claimed that the company was de facto bankrupt , though formally it continued to exist . Referring to the social security legislation , the applicant claimed that the authorities should have accepted the obligation to pay the indemnity instead of the bankrupt company . On DATE the Chaunskiy District Court accepted the applicant ’s arguments to have the company replaced by the social security authorities as defendants . Since the regional social security authorities were located in the city of GPE , the court decided to transfer the jurisdiction to another court . The case was thus transmitted to ORG of GPE .
On DATE the applicant requested the district prosecutor to initiate liquidation proceedings against the company .

On DATE the Presidium of the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE by way of supervisory review and remitted the case back to ORG . The ORG emphasised that the company was not formally liquidated , and that thus the first instance court had had no grounds for replacing the company as a defendant .
In DATE , DATE and DATE the applicant asked ORG to initiate liquidation proceedings against the company , but to no avail .

In DATE the applicant complained to the prosecutor about the failure of ORG to deal with his case . His complaint was forwarded to the President of ORG . By a letter of DATE the President informed the applicant that the delay could be explained in part by the backlog of cases in ORG and the lack of staff . The President further noted that the company did not exist de facto , but that it was not formally liquidated .

On DATE the applicant filed a new request with the district prosecutor ’s office , seeking to initiate liquidation proceedings against the company . It appears that this time the case was brought before the court by the authorities and on DATE ORG of GPE declared the company bankrupt . On DATE the company was formally liquidated .

On DATE the applicant applied to ORG , requesting it to replace the company with the ORG social security service as a defendant . On DATE the ORG replaced the defendant . The case was transmitted to ORG .

In DATE the applicant filed with ORG , ORG of GPE , and the Chukotka ORG a number of complaints with the view to speeding up the proceedings . On DATE the applicant increased the amount of pecuniary damages claimed from ORG to ORG CARDINAL .
On DATE ORG examined the case . It granted the applicant ’s claim in part , awarding him RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL in damages against the social security authorities .
The applicant appealed . On DATE the ORG overruled the first instance court and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination .

On DATE the applicant raised the amount of his claim to ORG CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a judgment whereby it confirmed in essence the judgment of DATE . The applicant was awarded RUR CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an appeal against this judgment . On DATE the first instance judgment was upheld by the Chukotka ORG .
